summary: Tribal lands hold considerable energy resources, such as oil, gas, coal, solar, and wind. Developing these resources can lead to income, jobs, and other economic benefits for tribes. In 2005, Congress authorized federal agencies to give preference to tribally-owned suppliers when buying energy. However, we found no agency has used this preference. There are no use requirements or goals for the preference, and officials at...
title: Tribal Energy: Opportunities Exist to Increase Federal Agencies' Use of the Tribal Preference Authority
